newsitem.title: USA: Datalogix adopts shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Datalogix adopts shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Datalogix International Inc said Wednesday it has adopted a shareholder rights plan in which preferred stock purchase rights will be distributed as a dividend at a rate of one right for each share of common stock.
The rights, which are to expire August 27, 2006, will be extended to common stock held at the close of business on September 9.
The company said the rights will not prevent a takeover, but should encourage any prospective buyers to negotiate with the board of directors before attempting a takeover.
Each right will allow shareholders to buy 1/1000 of a newly issued share of Series A preferred stock at an exercise price of $30, the company said.

The rights can be exercised if an individual or group acquires 20 percent or more of the company's common stock, or makes a tender or exchange offer for 20 percent or more of the company's common stock.
Datalogix provides software for managing the manufacturing and financial operations.
